Articles.Content:
Sorry, if this has been suggested before.

been thinking about thinking about fuel management.

there are mods available. TAC fuel balancer for one, but I thought that allot if not all of fuel transfer and balance issues could be solved with 1 new part.

Fuel balance pipe.

it works just like the Fuel pipe you attach to one tank, then the other in any direction. from that point on the two tanks are effectively the same vessel.

fuel is drained evenly by volume (the same % in each tank). you can also close a tank with the existing tick/cross interface.

the final thing to add to fix fuel management is adding transfer in/transfer out function to docking ports. maybe also a Dump Fuel option if the docking port is not connected to anything.

having the ability to setup "tank groups" would make fuel transfers and balancing much much easier.

Edited July 9, 2014 by Capt Snuggler
Yes. This would make my overly large launch stages with shared capacity much easier to build.
Doesn't a fuel line loop achieve the same thing?

Doesn't a fuel line loop achieve the same thing?

no. as i understand it, it will always drain from one tank first. causing craft (especially space planes) to become unbalanced. I remember Kasuha did some research in to the fuel flow system.

also, if you transfer fuel into a tank that is in a fuel line loop it will not balance between all the tanks in the loop. it will only top up the one tank.
